competitive_gaps: Transparent pricing and value education - most coffee shops don't explain why specialty coffee costs more or what makes it different
Real-time seating/crowding updates - customers want to know if they'll find a seat before making the trip
Detailed dietary/allergen information - many shops have alternative milks but don't clearly communicate full ingredient lists or preparation methods
Barista expertise and coffee education content - most shops don't leverage their staff knowledge for content marketing
Sustainability storytelling beyond surface level - customers care but most shops only mention 'fair trade' without deeper impact stories
Workspace etiquette and guidelines - remote workers want to know the unwritten rules about how long they can stay
Coffee subscription or delivery models for regulars - most shops miss opportunity for recurring revenue from loyal customers
Sensory descriptions of coffee profiles - most menus list origin but not flavor notes in accessible language
Community event programming beyond open mics - opportunities for coffee tastings, brewing classes, meet-the-roaster events
Personalization at scale - loyalty apps exist but don't offer truly personalized recommendations based on past orders

ugc_prompts.prompt: Show us your 'coffee face' - that first sip expression when our coffee hits different. Film yourself taking the first sip, tag us for a chance to win free coffee for a month.
What's your coffee order say about you? Film yourself ordering, then reveal what you're really like. Bonus points for barista reactions. Most creative wins a $50 gift card.

viral_triggers.angle: Barista reacts to celebrity coffee orders - making drinks exactly as A-listers order them with commentary on why their choices are actually genius (or questionable)
viral_triggers.why: Celebrity culture + insider knowledge + humor. Taps into parasocial relationships and coffee snobbery in entertaining way. Highly shareable to friends who order similar drinks.

viral_triggers.angle: Coffee shop math exposed - transparent breakdown showing exactly where your $6 latte money goes: beans ($0.80), milk ($0.60), labor ($2.10), rent ($1.50), cup ($0.40), profit ($0.60)
viral_triggers.why: Addresses #1 objection (price) with radical transparency. Surprising education content people share to justify their spending or debate in comments. Builds trust through honesty.
